business.headline: Ford pauses shipments of SUVs, sports cars and other models to ChinaFord has halted exports of key US-built vehicles to China amid rising tariffs and trade tensions, impacting a once-profitable segment of its business, WSJ reports. Engine shipments, however, continue.
No GST on UPI transactions over Rs 2,000, government clarifiesUPI payments, especially those made to merchants, currently don't attract any extra charges like GST.

ICICI Bank cuts FD and savings rates. Check what's newIf you have a savings account with ICICI Bank, you'll now earn slightly less. For balances below Rs 50 lakh, the new interest rate is 2.75% per annum, down from 3%.

Infosys lets go of 240 new recruits, offers free upskilling: ReportThe impacted employees joined the company in October 2024 as part of a training batch. The freshers were hired for two roles; System Engineers (SE) and Digital Specialist Engineers (DSE).

Nvidia to keep serving Chinese firms despite massive AI chip export lossHuang's statement comes at a time when the United States has tightened rules around exporting advanced chips to China. The restrictions, announced under the Donald Trump administration, are part of an ongoing trade war between the two countries.

Want to change your tax regime while filing ITR? Here's what you should knowLet's say you had earlier chosen the old tax regime, but now the new regime appears more beneficial after reviewing your finances. Can you change it when filing your ITR? Let's find out here.

TCS denies job bias against US employees, calls allegations 'misleading': ReportThe complaints have mostly come from workers in the US who are over 40 and not of non-South Asian ethnic backgrounds. They believe TCS chose them for layoffs during the tech industry slowdown, while keeping younger Indian workers on H-1B visas.

How Jaggi brothers squandered borrowed money, killed BluSmartSebi's interim order exposed how the Jaggi brothers may have taken investors for a ride, not in an EV, but in a web of financial mismanagement.
Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

Surprise rally lights up Dalal Street, Sensex jumps 1,500 points. Here's whyShare market today: Despite a slight uptick in volatility, sentiment turned decisively positive as fears around global trade tensions began to fade. Broader market indices joined the rally, reflecting widespread optimism among investors.

End of the road for BluSmart as Sebi exposes Gensol fraudMany users across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai reported that they could no longer book rides through the BluSmart app. The company also sent a notification to users stating that bookings were being temporarily closed.

Infosys Q4 results today: All eyes on FY26 outlook, dividend detailsInfosys Q4FY25 results: As the second-largest software services exporter gears up to release its earnings, investors will be watching closely for guidance on FY26 revenue growth, margins, and management's take on business sentiment in key markets.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Explained: Why Nvidia's market value dropped $148 billion overnightNvidia shares were hit hard in the overnight trading session on Wall Street, falling nearly 7% and losing $148 billion in market value.

Wipro shares tank 6% in early trade despite strong Q4 earnings. Buy or sell?Wipro share price: At 9:20 am, Wipro shares were trading 5.33% lower at Rs 234.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. The decline came after the company reported its earnings post-market hours on Wednesday.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Rio Tinto partners with Indian firm to explore low-carbon aluminium projectThe potential development could see up to 1 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of primary aluminium smelting and 2 mtpa of alumina production, both energized by renewable wind and solar power, supported by pumped hydro storage, the global miner said.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open lower. Here's whyDespite the weak outlook for Thursday's session, Sensex and Nifty have seen a strong upward trend in the last few days. In the past three sessions, Nifty50 has gone up by 4.6% while Sensex has gained 4.3%.

Stocks to watch on April 17: Wipro, Gensol, Tata Steel, BEL, Paytm, Hero MotoCorpSeveral companies will announce their results for Q4 FY25 on Thursday. These include Infosys, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Jio Financial Services, HDFC Asset Management Company, Tata Elxsi, National Standard (India), and E2E Networks.

21 acres for just 99 paise: Big land allotment to TCS as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

entertainment.headline: Jaat director says film was tweaked before backlash: No filmmaker wants to hurtJaat director Gopichand Malineni finally addressed the controversial church scene in the recently released film. An FIR was filed for allegedly hurting religious sentiments, leading to the scene's removal.
Sonakshi Sinha as Nikita Roy in brother Kussh's directorial debutSonakshi Sinha is gearing up for her next film, 'Nikita' Roy, which also marks the directorial debut of her brother, Kussh Sinha.

Urvashi Rautela says she was worshipped as 'Damdami Mai', reacts to temple remarkUrvashi Rautela's team released an official statement demanding legal action against those who took her remark on the 'Urvashi Temple' out of context. The actor's team further agreed with her claim about being worshipped as 'Damdami Mai' at Delhi University.

Deepika Padukone remembers Irrfan, announces Piku's re-release in theatresDeepika Padukone, Irrfan and Amitabh Bachchan's 'Piku' will re-release in theatres. The announcement was made by Deepika on April 19.

Ginny & Georgia 3 teaser: The mother-daughter duo return with more drama and twistsThe much-anticipated third season of 'Ginny and Georgia' is set to release soon on Netflix. The new teaser, released on Friday, promises more drama and excitement.

From lyrics to titles: How Bollywood plays on nostalgia and numerologyEver wondered why so many film titles sound like your favourite old songs? From catchy hooks to cosmic calculations, Bollywood filmmakers are increasingly turning to iconic lyrics as their film titles.

Kesari 2: The untold story of murder of history of Jallianwala BaghIn 'Kesari 2', director Karan Singh Tyagi puts together characters from completely different episodes of history, and gets confused between Brigadier General Reginald Dyer and Lt. Governor Michael O'Dwyer, and cooks up a fictitious trial that never happened.

Jaat box office Day 9: Sunny Deol's film sees minor dip due to Akshay's Kesari 2 'Jaat' faced a tough challenge from 'Kesari Chapter 2' at the box office on Friday. The Sunny Deol starrer could have performed better on its second Friday, also considering that it was a Good Friday holiday. However, it earned in the range of Rs 4 crore.

All about Anurag Kashyap's alleged casteist remark, and police complaintAnurag Kashyap has upset a section of people by allegedly making a casteist remark against Brahmins on social media while responding to a user. Now, a complaint has been filed against him with Mumbai Police seeking an FIR. Kashyap's apology on April 18 followed the complaint.

Kesari 2 box office Day 1: Akshay's film off to decent start amid positive responseAkshay Kumar and R Madhavan's 'Kesari Chapter 2' is expecting a weekend push amid a positive response from the audience after opening on a decent note at the box office.

Martha Stewart shades Katy Perry's space ride with throwback zero-gravity videoMartha Stewart subtly mocked Katy Perry's brief spaceflight by posting her own zero-gravity experience from 2006. The post reignited debate over celebrity space tourism and whether it merits the title "astronaut."

Jordan Peele's 'Him' turns NFL glory into nightmare in new horror thrillerJordan Peele's upcoming horror film Him follows a young footballer's twisted comeback under a mysterious NFL star's guidance, blending sports, fame, and psychological horror. It hits theaters on September 19.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs' trial to begin May 5 despite push for postponementA judge denied Sean "Diddy" Combs' request to delay his sex trafficking trial, set for May 5. He faces serious charges spanning two decades, which he denies as consensual encounters.

Anurag Kashyap apologises for Brahmin remark: No action worth your daughter...Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has issued a public apology following a controversial remark about Brahmins in the wake of the ongoing 'Phule' controversy. Late Friday night, Kashyap shared a lengthy note on social media, revealing that his family had been receiving rape and death threats.

Watch: Tom Cruise performs daring helicopter stunt in new Mission Impossible clipTom Cruise takes on one of his most challenging stunts yet in 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning'. With no stunt double, Cruise navigates a helicopter through rugged terrain, showcasing his dedication to authentic action.

Anurag Kashyap's controversial remark on Brahmins sparks outrage amid Phule rowAmidst the ongoing debates about the upcoming film 'Phule', Anurag Kashyap's provocative comment has sparked outrage. The film, depicting the Phule couple's fight against caste and gender inequality, is now delayed for further dialogue.

Prabhas enjoys month-long vacation in Italy, set to resume shooting in JunePan-India star Prabhas is on a month-long holiday in Italy to recharge after a hectic filming schedule, and will return in June to resume work on his upcoming projects including The Raja Saab and Fauji.

Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' drops controversial scene after Christians demand ban on filmThe makers of Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' have removed a controversial scene depicting Randeep Hooda standing inside a church. This comes after the Christian community said that the scene hurt their religious sentiments.

Revisiting Hospital Playlist: Why the show still manages to strike a chord'Hospital Playlist' debuted quietly in 2020 but quickly became a beloved series for its authentic portrayal of friendship among five doctors. Created by Shin Won-ho and Lee Woo-jung, it offered a rare glimpse into the emotional resilience of healthcare professionals.

general news.headline: Elon Musk to visit India this year as Tesla readies debut, praises PM ModiThe Prime Minister's conversation with Elon Musk comes at a crucial juncture for both nations, as New Delhi and Washington are trying to erase differences on tariffs and work on convergences towards a trade deal.

Systematic persecution: India slams Bangladesh over Hindu leader's killingIndia on Saturday reacted strongly to the abduction and killing of a Hindu leader in Bangladesh, calling upon the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government to 'live up to its responsibility of protecting all minorities, including Hindus.'

'Abusing Brahmins....': Anurag Kashyap's apology does little to soothe mattersFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap has faced backlash over his controversial remarks against Brahmins amid a row over the upcoming film 'Phule'.

The pull of prestige: Why everyone wants a piece of DLF CamelliasWhile the cynosure is, of course, the huge sum of money squandered by the Jaggi brothers, people can't help but pause for a moment and ask: what is it about this ultra-luxurious condominium that sets a benchmark even for the crème de la crème of the country?
Why Indian parents are torn between CBSE and international boardsIn the past ten years, India has witnessed a 300% growth in IB and Cambridge schools, particularly in urban areas.

GT vs DC Live: Injury-hit Delhi Capitals face tricky test in AhmedabadIPL 2025, DC vs GT Live Score and Updates: Delhi Capitals, who are on top of the points table, will be looking to manage their injury concerns and continue their good run. Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad is going to be a tough challenge for Axar Patel and his men.

4 dead, several trapped as Delhi building collapses, 14 rescuedAccording to the police, at least 14 people have been rescued so far. Rescue teams from the NDRF, firefighters, and Delhi Police have rushed to the spot. The police further said that they are probing the cause behind the building's collapse.

Indian student, 21, killed by stray bullet in Canada, was 'innocent bystander'Hamilton Police said Harsimrat Randhawa was waiting at a bus stop when a stray bullet struck her during a shooting incident involving two vehicles.

Unrest, crime and terrorism: US issues new travel advisory for Bangladesh In its advisory updated on April 18, the US Department of State issued a "Level 3: Reconsider Travel" alert for Bangladesh, and a stricter "Level 4: Do Not Travel" warning for the Chittagong Hill Tracts region.

Jaat director says film was tweaked before backlash: No filmmaker wants to hurtJaat director Gopichand Malineni finally addressed the controversial church scene in the recently released film. An FIR was filed for allegedly hurting religious sentiments, leading to the scene's removal.

'Strangers in own country': Muslim students outnumber ethnic Austrians in ViennaEthnic Austrians are now a minority in Vienna's elementary schools, with Muslim pupils rising to a whopping 41.2 per cent. The shift has sparked political backlash, language challenges, and growing concerns over classroom disorder.

Anurag Kashyap apologises for Brahmin remark: No action worth your daughter...Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has issued a public apology following a controversial remark about Brahmins in the wake of the ongoing 'Phule' controversy. Late Friday night, Kashyap shared a lengthy note on social media, revealing that his family had been receiving rape and death threats.

Watch: Arvind Kejriwal, wife shake a leg to Pushpa song at daughter's engagementArvind Kejriwal, AAP chief, was seen dancing with his wife Sunita Kejriwal to the hit Pushpa song "Angaro Ka Ambar Sa" at their daughter's engagement ceremony in Delhi.

Urvashi Rautela says she was worshipped as 'Damdami Mai', reacts to temple remarkUrvashi Rautela's team released an official statement demanding legal action against those who took her remark on the 'Urvashi Temple' out of context. The actor's team further agreed with her claim about being worshipped as 'Damdami Mai' at Delhi University.

NCERT says new school textbook names 'rooted in India's culture', not just HindiNCERT has responded to criticism over Hindi-sounding textbook titles, with an official response, saying names reflect Indian culture and diversity, not language bias.

KL Rahul-Kevin Pietersen banter goes on: DC star takes Maldives dig at mentorKL Rahul took a cheeky dig at Kevin Pietersen's Maldives break, joking about a mentor's "duties" during practice, continuing the light-hearted banter that's kept DC fans entertained throughout IPL 2025.

India to get 8 new Cheetahs from Botswana, first 4 to arrive in MayOver Rs 112 crore has been spent on the cheetah project in India so far, with nearly 67% of the total funds directed toward cheetah rehabilitation efforts in Madhya Pradesh.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Governor Michael O'Dwyer, and cooks up a fictitious trial that never happened.

Telugu actor's drunk 'driver' loses control, rams 6 vehicles in Chennai; 4 injuredWhile descending the Kathipara flyover towards Alandur Metro Station, the driver lost control due to over-speeding and ploughed into three motorcycles, two autorickshaws, and one car.

Woman gets fiance attacked by lover 2 days before wedding, he goes into comaThe victim's family alleged that the assault was planned by his fiancee, Neha, who was in a relationship with the accused. They said Gaurav called them before slipping into unconsciousness and told them who had attacked him.

Canadian vlogger calls India 'shocking', shares life lessons after 5-week tripA Canadian vlogger described India as "the most shocking" of the 37 countries he's visited. In a now-viral post on Instagram, he listed the life lessons he learned after a 5-week trip to the country.

5.8 magnitude quake hits Afghanistan border, tremors felt in Kashmir, Delhi-NCRAccording to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS), the earthquake occurred at 12:17 PM IST at a depth of 86 km beneath the surface. The epicentre was located in the Afghanistan-Tajikistan border area, a region prone to seismic activity due to tectonic movements.

sports.headline: Dented Rajasthan face big Lucknow challenge featuring a Mayank Yadav returnRR vs LSG, IPL 2025 match preview: With their IPL 2025 campaigns heading in different directions, RR and LSG prepare for a crucial Saturday clash in Jaipur—where momentum for one and survival for the other will be on the line.

Scotland, England in talks over forming combined Britain team at LA OlympicsThe England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) and Cricket Scotland have started talks about forming a combined Britain cricket team for the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, Cricket Scotland CEO Trudy Lindblade confirmed on Friday.

Ravi Bishnoi going from strength to strength after slow start: LSG coach KlusenerLSG assistant coach Lance Klusener feels that Ravi Bishnoi is going from strength to strength after making a slow start to life in the IPL 2025 campaign. Bishnoi is slowly finding form.

Nehal Wadhera celebrates perfect outing vs RCB, poses with Virat KohliIPL 2025: From a composed match-winning knock to a fiery celebration and a wholesome post-match picture with Virat Kohli, Nehal Wadhera's night at the Chinnaswamy had all the makings of a memorable IPL moment.

Unreal feeling: Rohit Sharma honoured to have stand named after himDuring the inauguration of the Mumbai T20 League, Rohit Sharma said he was honoured after getting a stand named after him at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

DC's fine start to IPL 2025 gives us cushion to back Fraser-McGurk: BadaniDC coach Hemang Badani feels that the team's fine start to IPL 2025 has given them the cushion to continue backing Jake Fraser-McGurk despite his poor form. Fraser-McGurk has struggled to get going this season after his impressive IPL 2024.

High-flyers Gujarat, Delhi face off in battle of contenders in AhmedabadIPL 2025, GT vs DC Match Preview: The high-flying GT and DC will square off at the Narendra Modi stadium in a battle of title contenders in IPL 2025. With both teams having superstars in their ranks, expect a thrilling contest in Ahmedabad on Saturday, April 19.

Kings on road, paupers at home: RCB's Chinnaswamy woes could cost them titleRCB continues to make the same mistakes at home as they suffered a third loss at the Chinnaswamy stadium on April 18 against PBKS. With their eyes on an elusive first title, Bengaluru need to make the Chinnaswamy a fortress quickly.

Alexander Zverev asks umpire to throw out heckler at Munich OpenGerman star Alexander Zverev complained to umpire Fergus Murphy after a fan heckled him during his Munich Open quarterfinal match on Friday against Tallon Griekspoor.

Tim David rewarded with POTM award despite RCB's defeat to PBKSIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Despite Bengaluru losing by 5 wickets, Tim David was rewarded with the Player of the Match award for scoring an unbeaten 50 and taking two catches against Punjab Kings.

Chahal's IPL 2025 turnaround: Shreyas Iyer reveals chat with PBKS spinnerPBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer revealed the chat he had with Yuzvendra Chahal as the leg-spinner continues his comeback in the IPL 2025 season. Chahal picked up two wickets against RCB on Friday, April 18.

RCB's disastrous home run continues as PBKS triumph in rain-marred gameIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) lost their third match in a row at home as Punjab Kings (PBKS) won by five wickets in the rain-marred contest on Friday at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Vintage RCB is back: Memes galore as PBKS run through hosts in BengaluruFans on social media trolled RCB after they crumbled against PBKS at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Friday, April 18. The likes of Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar and others failed on the night as RCB scored 95 in the 14-over game.

Arshdeep Singh gets Virat Kohli after scripting history for Punjab KingsIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Arshdeep Singh took the wicket of Phil Salt to become the all-time top wicket-taker for the Punjab Kings, after which he also accounted for the wicket of Virat Kohli.

LSG have the team to win IPL 2025: Assistant coach Klusener makes bold claimLSG assistant coach Lance Klusener feels that Lucknow has the team to go all the way in IPL 2025 and win their first title. LSG have won 4 out of their 7 matches and remain in the hunt for a place in the playoffs.

RCB vs PBKS: No Bengaluru return as Maxwell dropped, Stoinis returnsThere will be no Bengaluru return for Glenn Maxwell as the Australian all-rounder was dropped for the clash between RCB and PBKS at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Friday, April 18. Maxwell has been in poor form this season.

BCCI bans former Mumbai T20 League team franchise owner for fixing attemptGurmeet Singh Bhamrah, a former co-owner of a Mumbai T20 League franchise, has been banned for making corrupt approaches to Dhawal Kulkarni and Bhavin Thakkar during the event's 2019 edition.

WrestleMania 41: Date, schedule, predictions, how to watch John Cena vs Cody Rhodes matchWrestleMania 41 is expected to bring fans some exciting action. The event on April 19 and 20 will see a showdown between two of the biggest WWE stars, John Cena and Cody Rhodes.

NBA Playoffs Ad debut: Kendrick Lamar, Luka Doncic, and Gatorade team up for "Lose More. Win More." campaignThe NBA playoffs are heating up, and Gatorade has found the right moment to launch its powerful new campaign, "Lose More. Win More."  The campaign features a dynamic cast of athletes and artists, including rapper Kendrick Lamar, L.A. Lakers guard Luka Dončić, and WNBA star Caitlin Clark.

Rahul Dravid: My inability to walk has no effect on my coachingRajasthan Royals head coach Rahul Dravid has joked that his inability to walk has had no bearing on his coaching this season. Dravid had accepted the mistakes made by Rajasthan and said that they needed to minimise the small mistakes that they were making in all departments of the game.

Man United to fast track academy kids in PL, as focus shifts to Europa titleManchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has confirmed that the team will fast track the youngsters in Premier League as their focus shifts towards the Europa League title. United reached the semis after a dramatic second leg victory against Lyon.

Abishek Porel's retention, presence in all games show how much DC values him: BadaniDC coach Hemang Badani heaped praise on Abishek Porel and said that his retention and presence in all games shows the faith that the team have in him. Badani feels that Porel brings in a lot of value to the team as a left-handed batter.

Babar Azam either egoistic or too shy to seek advice: Zaheer AbbasLegendary batter Zaheer Abbas gave the example of Younis Khan, Pakistan's all-time top Test run-scorer, and said that Babar Azam needs to take advice from seniors to make a comeback.

GT proud of Sai Sudharsan's progress at the franchise: Assistant coachGujarat Titans assistant coach Aashish Kapoor is proud of young batter Sai Sudharsan's progress at the franchise. Sudharsan has been graduated to the opening spot this season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
